channel.title: sendFrame126
channel.description: I just added an achievement system, and when you complete the achievement (getting 100M attack experience) a window pops up by using the sendFrame126 method (same one that pops up when you level up a skill), but my question is how would you make the window only able to disappear by clicking the Click to Continue. The reason why I want to do this is because when you get an achievement you could still be attacking something and when you attack, it interrupts the sendFrame. I know the fix is by adding something to the sendFrame126 method, but my question is, what do I add? Thanks.

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Little button up at the top. RSWikia.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

AtomicInt_:

send the packet that ‘freezes’ the player and if your combat is half decent, you should have some type of ‘pause’ like for when you level up, you pause then have to click again to start attacking, set the pause to be for however long you need it to be.

Is there any resource that tells you what each individual packet does?

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

send the packet that ‘freezes’ the player and if your combat is half decent, you should have some type of ‘pause’ like for when you level up, you pause then have to click again to start attacking, set the pause to be for however long you need it to be.

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

imsuperman05:

Wait wait… You want to be able to keep the frame open even when the player moves? Show a picture of the frame pl0x.

I want all of the following to stop whenever the frame opens:

[ul][li]Combat[/li]
[li]Movement[/li][/ul]

@Atomic, yes, but that does not handle combat, or am I wrong?
@superman, Its kind of hard to take a picture of the frame when it disappears when you are attacking something.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

should be a setWalkableInterface method somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

AtomicInt_:

When you click the ‘click here to continue’ you should send a packet that closes interfaces from the server (in the button clicking packet) to the client.

Yes, but what I’m wanting is to where nothing else can interrupt the frame, except clicking click here to continue. I guess there would be various ways to go about making this possible. I’m trying to add a conditional statement which blocks out combat and walking, which would then make it to where you would have to either log out or click the ‘click here to continue’.

Edit: Thank you superman. I didn’t even know there was a method that handled that.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Delete that. It should close automatically whenever you fight anybody, or walk. The closeAllWindows() method in PlayerAssistant should handling the closing of frames, and dialogues.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

When you click the ‘click here to continue’ you should send a packet that closes interfaces from the server (in the button clicking packet) to the client.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

imsuperman05:

An packet is sent when you click “Click here to continue”. Find that packet handler, and mess with some of the code with some conditional statements.

Tried adding this to the processPacket method:

if (packetType == 126) {
			c.stopMovement();
		}

Obviously, it stops you from moving, which would be good if I could find out how to stop any type of movement, such as attacking, walking, etc.

Edit: The conditional statement I added above should cancel out walking while the packet is in use, but the packet is no longer being used when the frame disappears. Any help?

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame126

item.description:
